description: From Middle English dwynen, from Old English dwīnan, from Proto-Germanic *dwīnaną. Compare Low German dwienen, verdwienen, Dutch dwijnen, verdwijnen, West Frisian ferdwine, Icelandic dvína. See also dwindle.

verbs.description: dwine (third-person singular simple present dwines, present participle dwining, simple past and past participle dwined)

entries.meaning: (archaic outside Scotland and dialects) To wither, decline, pine away.
